```{r}
library(tidyverse)

```
```{r}
#upload my RGB data
rgb_data_unformatted <- read.csv("RGB_NITRATE_RAW_not_recomputed_12_18_23.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",",stringsAsFactors = FALSE) 
getwd()

```
# Ultimate goal here is to put 2 blank (or NA) rows in between EACH row so that we can go back and calucate the true RGB value using the  "Color value Matlab Sheet--recomputed" made by Jeff Chabot

#Data setup
Needs to have a column "row_number" with a simple integer for the length of the dataset
```{r}
rgb_formatted_data <- rgb_data_unformatted %>%
  group_split(row_number) %>%
  map_dfr(~ .x[1:(nrow(.x) + 2),]) #this adds two blank rows after every data row

write.csv(rgb_formatted_data, file="FORMATTED_RGB_NITRATE_RAW_not_recomputed_12_18_23.csv", row.names=TRUE)
```
